CatDescriptText: Mrs. Rose B. Guyton, 774 Anaheim Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?"  Answer reads: "I think that most of them do not. It would not hurt them if they did."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rose B. Guyton wearing plaid skirt and sleeveless blouse, standing next to two young children on sidewalk with car in background
